Бомбинго

[b] Game-play: [/b] Compared to Portal it is a lot smoother. The old puzzle elements are renewed and improved, a lot of good new mechanics have been added as well, (SPOILER) [spoiler] for example mobility gels, lasers, bridges, tractor beams and more. [/spoiler] Some cut-scenes here and there, a lot of loading screens. [u] 9/10 [/u]

[b] Level Design: [/b] The puzzles were all great, a lot of the solutions were quite easy though. The were only a few instances when it wasn't really obvious where the player should go. The final boss fight was a little anti-climactic. The gradual introduction of the mechanics is also there just like in Portal. [u] 8/10 [/u]

[b] Plot and Lore: [/b] Lore was much deeper than in Portal. The story is good, but could be better, as it is all built around the puzzles. Some major plot-holes that are kind of distracting, but nothing too big. (SPOILER) [spoiler] Wheatley at first didn't seem like the best antagonist, although the plot-twist midway into the game was quite good. [/spoiler] [u] 7/10 [/u]

[b] Acting/Writing: [/b] Some of the best acting in a game, great performances. Sometimes the game leaned into the humour a bit too much, it mostly consisted of insults. [u] 8.5/10 [/u]

[b] Style [/b] The style has completely changed since Portal, in most cases for the better. The style has strayed away even more from (SPOILER) [spoiler] the Half-Life look and vibe that was still present in Portal. [/spoiler] [u] 8.5/10 [/u]

Overall [u] 8.5/10 [/u]
Recommended

I have bought the Portal™ bundle, played both games in one go and am not surprised, that they are fucking awesome. A must for every steam library, especially when you're a fan of VALVE
The user-designed stages make for basically perpetual gameplay. This game is a TRIUMPH of humanity. It's a beautiful thing.

This game started it all for me, one of the first games I owned on steam. Portal 2 is a game with soul, you don't feel like this game was made to make money, you feel like it was made because the developers loved what they were doing. This game has a fantastic soundtrack, engaging gameplay, compelling story (If you look deeper than surface level) and great graphics for the time. Portal 2 ties in with the first Portal very well, keeping many of the same mannerisms as Portal 1, be it the fun end credits songs across both games, or the lore that carries over. Good Stuff.
If you don't own this game, it will honestly take you through one of the best gaming experiences ever.

[h1] 게이머라면 누구나 해봐야 할
     명작 퍼즐 플랫포머 게임! [/h1]

[b] ◈ 플레이후기 ◈[/b] - ★★★★★
=========================================
처음 포탈1이 나와서 플레이 했을 때
아이디어는 참신하다고 생각했었지만
게임자체로는 큰 재미를 느끼지 못했었는데
포탈2는 기억에 남을 만큼 재밌게 플레이했음.
뭔가.. 흠잡을 것이 없음.

퍼즐게임은 사실 취향을 많이 타는 편이고
머리를 써야 하는 점과 휙휙 돌아가는 3D화면 때문에
약간 멀미가 생기기도 하지만
이 게임은 게임 역사에 한 획을 그을 만큼
전문가와 유저들 모두 인정하는 명작이기도 하고
스토리, 연출, 아이디어 그리고 재미까지
뭐 하나 빠지는 것 없는 작품이니
아직도 망설이고 계시다면 더 이상 지체하지 말고
꼭 한번 플레이 해보시기를 바래요~

■ 포탈2에는 포탈1의 거의 모든 장치들이 나오고
   볼륨도 3~4배 정도는 크기 때문에
   한 작품만 해보고 싶으시다면 포탈2를 하세요~!
   ( 포탈1은 포탈2의 튜토리얼 같은 느낌! ) ■

-------------------------------------------------------

When you think Portal 1 was the best game you have ever played, Portal 2 will blow you away. This game is a fucking masterpiece! Fantastic gameplay, an enhancing story, addicting puzzles and great voice acting. Just buy this game and enjoy your 5 hour long journey, you won't regret it at all!

Amazing game! Probably one of my favorite video game series from any genre. The puzzles are well thought out, the writing is very humorous, then voice acting is great, and the art direction and setting are top notch. This game has aged wonderfully if it came out today it would still feel fresh. The concept of going through portals is just as mind bending and innovative as it's ever been. I still think the graphics look good for the engine it's on, which is a testament to the artists who worked on Portal 2.  Looks even better with the right ReShade settings. The co op is very fun and chaotic as well, which adds even more hours of fun to a great game.  Here's to hoping for a sequel if we ever get one.

Bon ça fait presque une décennie que ce jeux est sorti je l'ai fini à 100% plusieur fois découvert tout les Easter eggs terminé le mode coop écouté GLaDos dans toute les langues débloquer le badge au niveau maximal collectionner tout les arrières plans devenir 126eme meilleur speed runner en co-op jai même réussi à débloquer des emotes pour les robot (que l'on doit normalement acheter) grâce à la console j'ai aussi terminé une quantité astronomique de map du workshop, j'ai fini portal story Mel et aperture tag. Bref tout ces points évoqué qui me donne envie de poser une question :

MAIS P*** DE BORDEL DE M**** C'EST QUAND QU'IL SORT LE 3EME PARCE J'EN PEUT PLUS DE CET ABRUTI DE WHEATLEY DES MÊME BLAGUES DE GLADOS PARCE QUE POUR HALF LIFE 3 LA YA DU MONDE MAIS POUR LE VRAI MEILLEUR JEUX DE L'UNIVERS PERSONNE NE MILITE POUR UN TROISIÈME OPUS

Одна из лучших игр мира. 10 турелей из 10

SOME SPOILERS MAY NOT BE PROPERLY MARKED. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

If you enjoyed "Portal", or found this game through a recommendation or otherwise, congrats! This is an incredible game, and worth the play-through!

[b]NOTE:[/b] As mentioned, there is a previous game. [i]However,[/i] it is not necessary to play it to enjoy this game. In fact, they end up covering anything important you may have missed at the beginning. I do personally recommend you play the first game, though.

[b]STORY LINE:[/b] Unlike its predecessor, "Portal 2" follows a fun and creative plot, picking up from the end of the previous game. There are a few twists, and it's well-written with sarcasm, humor, and seriousness galore.

[b]GAME PLAY:[/b] Similar to "Portal". Puzzles that slowly get harder as you get further into the game. Requires brain power. Usage of a portal device. As I said in my review for "Portal", it's not surprising you use a portal device, with a game name like "Portal 2".

[b]GAME CONTROLS:[/b] It is [i]highly recommended[/i] that if you are using a laptop or any computer with a touchpad that you use a mouse. Otherwise, your gaming experience will be very, very difficult. Arrow-keys are used for moving your character around. Spacebar to jump. Mouse used to look around and shoot portals. Other buttons are explained in game.

[b]CHARACTERS:[/b] You play as a mute character. They do not speak. Unlike the previous game, however, you interact with a much more... chatty AI, who isn't the brightest tool in shed, but has a heart of gold. [spoiler]Y'know. Until they take over.[/spoiler] Also, there is a reappearance of a character from the previous game. Character development.

[b]CO-OP:[/b] Yes! There is Co-Op! A true test of your loyalty with your friend... or possibly your sense of humor. Unlike the previous game, you can now play with a friend as two robots completing tests. It is recommended to play this after completing this game. It's not necessary, however.

[b]CAUTION:[/b] Please keep in mind that looking at these spoilers may change or ruin your experience, as they are not necessary for enjoyment of the game. They are only if you get disturbed easily by a lack of nothing, loud noises, or sudden events. If you [spoiler]die[/spoiler], you may be kind of freaked out. Also, [spoiler] it may be startling to encounter turrets, which will shoot at you[/spoiler]. You also encounter (PRETTY BIG SPOILER, I LIGHTLY DON'T RECOMMEND LOOKING) [spoiler]an abandoned facility, which may be creepy if you don't like that stuff[/spoiler]. Finally, (MAJOR SPOILER, I DO NOT RECOMMEND LOOKING) [spoiler]yet again, you're betrayed by an AI. Go-freaking-figure.[/spoiler].

"Portal 2" is an amazing game that will keep you preoccupied for a while. Whether you're enjoying the sarcastic remarks of a character, figuring out how to solve a puzzle, or just plain impressed with its good graphics, "Portal 2" is awesome for people of all ages.
